title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water.
While the pasta cooks, fry the pancetta in a large pan until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Parmesan, and black pepper.
Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water.
Toss the hot pasta with the pancetta, then quickly stir in the egg mixture.
Add pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra Parmesan and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, and all the spices for the marinade
Add the chicken pieces to this mixture, coat well, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour
Preheat your grill or oven to 200°C (400°F) or heat a skillet
Cook the marinated chicken pieces until they’re charred and cooked through (about 5-7 minutes per side in the oven or 4-5 minutes on a grill/pan). Set aside
Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and stir to coat. Simmer for another 5-7 minutes so the chicken absorbs the flavors
Serve hot with naan, basmati rice, or roti

title: Canadian loud
summary: A classic Canadian dish with native spices and maple syrup.
ingredients: 1 cup cheese curds (or shredded mozzarella if curds aren’t available)
2 cups beef or chicken gravy (store-bought or homemade)
instructions: peel and cut them into thick fries. Soak the cut potatoes in cold water for 30 minutes
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 175°C (350°F)
Drain and pat the potatoes dry, then fry them in batches until golden brown and crispy
If using frozen fries, bake or fry according to package instructions
Remove fries and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt.
